body_html: On Docker Hub you can pick which version they have different tags in the tach section, there is 0.9 and even nightlys. The other stuff your best bet is to create our own image based off they one they have. The current image installs the latest pip and jupyter when you run it, if you want to update you can either create bash into the container and update or rerun the container.

body: On Docker Hub you can pick which version they have different tags in the tach section, there is 0.9 and even nightlys. The other stuff your best bet is to create our own image based off they one they have. The current image installs the latest pip and jupyter when you run it, if you want to update you can either create bash into the container and update or rerun the container.
